body_content.explanation: involving one thing or person hitting another with a lot of force, for example involving your feet hitting the ground when you run or jump:
examples: Even occasional high-impact exercise can have significant health benefits.
A one-hour, high-impact aerobics class will burn around 500 calories.
Modern rugby includes a large number of high-impact collisions.

body_content.explanation: having a large or powerful effect:
examples: For mass-market, high-impact advertising, television used to be the obvious choice.
This is a high-impact, low-cost way to dramatically improve your results.

body_content.explanation: able to deal with the force of a strong hit without being seriously damaged:
examples: Whitewater kayaks are generally made out of high-impact plastic.
